intro: Grindelia andina, commonly known as the Andean gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flower clusters that are often mistaken for individual flowers. Grindelia andina thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its native habitat.
